history.content:
Looking to do DS in addition to EECS. On the CoE website, there is a requirement that:

  • Your program must include a minimum of five upper division courses that are distinct to your engineering major (5 classes beyond any that overlap)

I understand I can only double-count 2 upper-divs between EECS and DS. But this clause in particular confuses me. If this is the case, would I then have to take 7 upper divison EECS courses (rather than the 5 required to meet 20 upper div units) if I double-counted two of them? What is the point of being able to double-count if that is the case?

Thanks for any clarification you can provide. As an aside, if anyone who has gone through this has recs on scheduling for the next three years, that would be great.
history.subject: EECS Simultaneous Degree
